Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lid; interior reserved; on vertical edge, dots; exterior: line at edge; black-figure animal frieze to right: from left, forepart and trace of muzzle of a panther (added red on chest and paw); at right, hind part of siren with wing curving up, with red band on tail, and part of wing; added white dots on tail and wing feathers; incised blob rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1924,1201.29 and joins Boston 88.1078.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B103.25)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p.227, no.10)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 344, no. B422)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (p. 147, note 43)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0826) (Phase 1)
